responses.rationale: The segment uses factual language ('widespread', 'caused ongoing outbreaks') without high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment states risks are low and describes infections factually ('rare, sporadic infections') without high-potency framing.
The segment states a factual outcome ('KILLS') but does not use a high-potency verb or metaphor listed in Q2.
The segment provides a factual description of symptoms ('Neither person reported respiratory symptoms') without high-potency language.
The segment provides a factual description of symptoms ('experienced mild symptoms') without high-potency language.
The segment describes actions ('collaborate closely', 'support state-run efforts') without high-potency framing.
The segment states a factual relationship ('were unrelated') without high-potency language.
The segment states a factual finding ('tested positive') without high-potency language.
The segment uses a psychological verb ('raised questions') without a vivid intensifier or scale, which is coded Neutral under Q2 rules.
The segment states a factual event ('second human case... has been confirmed') without high-potency language.
The segment uses control/containment metaphors ('reined in', 'stamped out') which do not frame the threat's impact alarmingly under Q2.

The segment describes actions ('on the ground to help contain and eradicate') without high-potency framing of the threat.
